column33:
Triptease-owned integration, via onboard script. If they have a GTM container, request access—otherwise send to client for implementation by account manager/support.
 

 In addition, send the following instructions to client - 
 You would need to create an SR (Service Request) via your My Oracle Support (MOS) Tool with a message to whitelist *.triptease.io domain. 
 Log this case against the OHDCS (Oracle Hospitality Distribution Cloud Service fka. http://myfidelio.net/). 
 The application team will take care of the whitelisting to allow the Triptease scripts fire on your booking engine.

column33: Click "Setup," then "Property Settings". Scroll down to section #2, under Online reservation settings you will see two boxes "Tracking code for confirmation page only" and "Tracking code for all booking engine pages" where analytics code can be added. Add Beacon or integration builder-created scripts.

column32: In Line/In Page Message not supported. (this is happening because the booking engine is mounted in a Shadow DOM (you can think of this like a new version of an iframe). As a result, the way we find elements with an XPath selector is breaking as it cannot "see" into the booking engine's shadow DOM.)
